users.name: Bob Singh
users.bio: Sign linguist who loves explaining nuances.

questions.title: How do you differentiate between QUESTION and QUERY in ASL?
questions.body: I often see different movements used for similar meanings. What's considered correct?

questions.title: Best practices for teaching fingerspelling to beginners?
questions.body: Looking for tips that help students remember letter transitions.

answers.body: Use palm orientation to differentiate. QUERY has a subtle wrist twist to emphasize the clarification.
It depends on regional usage. In my area we drag the QUESTION sign slightly longer.
Gamify the sessions. Time-based drills with small rewards keep learners engaged.
